body: LGTM, when is this going in? Ah, just did.

Race condition in our comments. ;) With RocksDB is a bit tricky. Older releases are not necessarily more stable. We could ask the RocksDB people what they recommend. Otherwise, the best option is probably to go for latest since it's early in our release cycle.
I'd recommend trust the rocksDB community using the latest stable version, as I agree with @ijuma that for OS projects it is usually better to use newer version.
Test failure seems unrelated. Merging.

Is it common that users may want different configs for different internal topics? cc @theduderog Anyways if that is really a common case we may consider allowing users to override in the code (papi or dsl) than in configs anyways.

@dguy Could you add the corresponding doc changes in this PR as well, since it is the main reason we included the docs folder in kafka repo anyways :)

Thanks @bbejeck , I agree with @dguy on delegating old configs to new configs if it is not overridden. My thinking is that if user still calls `key/valueSerde`, it means she does not know or care about the deprecation yet, so she is highly likely not specifying for the new configs at all.
LGTM. @dguy leaving to you to merge :)

@guozhangwang we currently allow that for change logs via
StateStoreSupplier. I think we should also allow users to set default
configs
On Sat, 1 Jul 2017 at 00:35, Guozhang Wang <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Is it common that users may want different configs for different internal
> topics? cc @theduderog <https://github.com/theduderog> Anyways if that is
> really a common case we may consider allowing users to override in the code
> (papi or dsl) than in configs anyways.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3459#issuecomment-312393987>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AADWLdUUqafczi5l9UN--GhCcnsfj92aks5sJYYxgaJpZM4OJfOs>
> .
>

@rajinisivaram @ijuma 

Thanks for reviewing the PR. I ll submit the unit test for `InflightRequests` shortly.
@dguy Yeah I know, I was only referring to repartition topics.
cc @norwood @xvrl i don't know how common it is but there are reasons (faster recovery) for setting small segment size on some repartition topics but not necessarily all of them.
@guozhangwang LGTM

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.11/5854/
Test FAILed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).

@junrao Thanks so much for detailed review. I have addressed most of the comments in the updated patch. The main remaining issues are 1) whether we should invoke `ReplicaManager.handleLogDirFailure()` in `LogManager.handleLogDirFailure()` and 2) whether/how we can handle `IOException` in the methods of `TransactionStateManager`. I have provided explanation under the corresponding comments.

BTW, there is one comment regarding a line in `Partition.scala` that can only be replied in https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2929/files but not in this page.

It looks like the bug has already been fixed on trunk. Will fix these tests after I am back.

Updated. It did leave `createStreamTask` and `createStandbyTask` as `protected` for now and created a JIRA (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-5551). Both method are use in many test cases and it's a larger refactoring.
Updated to use `AbstractNode`
